cyclone.name: PETER
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles north of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, forecast to slow and turn northwest then north passing just north of Puerto Rico and then toward the open Atlantic in the general direction of Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall expected – center passes offshore north of Puerto Rico

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, U.S. Virgin Islands, and northern coast of Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 kt) possible, mainly Tuesday daytime when the center is north of San Juan
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; however, large northerly swells and hazardous surf/rip currents will affect north-facing beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches with isolated higher totals could cause urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along exposed north-facing beaches
